TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
are you ready to show the crowd about the models,beale?

They've been a bit neglected at the moment

I've been messing about with some plugin stuff, but come the weekend I should be able to get the ATV textured up and ready to show

http://i.imgur.com/uspknYX.png

Tantares, 1.875m rescaled Pollux, 1.25m rescaled Pollux, 0.625m Pollux, 2.5m SDHI/Stock CM

I think the 0.625m version is very small, 1.875 is a bit too big.

1.25m would fit nicely in my opinion.

Very interesting seeing them all side by side...

1.25m does look more natural in that frame, I agree.

I'll try these configs myself and see what works best, thanks for demonstrating these size differences

Did I release the van in the last update ?

Hi, I found another issue with the TKS (Sorry, but I really have a soft spot for it). It's great that it is controllable from the control block, but the control block is oriented so that it flies "backwards". I know it's confusing with a TKS, but bear with me. A TKS is launched with the capsule up, but its cargo block engines should point upwards at launch. After separation from the booster it should flip 180Ã‚Â° and face with the docking port and the control block forward and with the capsule backward. When you try to control it from the control block (the double-cone shaped part), you have to transfer a kerbal there (which is great), but when you try to "control it from here", the craft retains the same orientation as when controlled from the capsule.

Now this is a minor point as long as you use a docking port in the "front/bottom", but it complicates its use in IVA - the kerbal is looking out of the window in the correct direction, but the indicators are backwards.

Is it possible to have a part that would have the control direction as "down" in the VAB?

Also, the TAC imbalances are still there. I checked, the stock 3-kerbal capsule has 3 units of oxygen. The VA capsule has about 1600. I don't know how long either will last, but I think that much shouldn't be there.

I do appreciate shifting the parts in the tech tree, thanks! It makes much more sense now!

Hi, I found another issue with the TKS (Sorry, but I really have a soft spot for it). It's great that it is controllable from the control block, but the control block is oriented so that it flies "backwards". I know it's confusing with a TKS, but bear with me. A TKS is launched with the capsule up, but its cargo block engines should point upwards at launch. After separation from the booster it should flip 180Ã‚Â° and face with the docking port and the control block forward and with the capsule backward. When you try to control it from the control block (the double-cone shaped part), you have to transfer a kerbal there (which is great), but when you try to "control it from here", the craft retains the same orientation as when controlled from the capsule.

Now this is a minor point as long as you use a docking port in the "front/bottom", but it complicates its use in IVA - the kerbal is looking out of the window in the correct direction, but the indicators are backwards.

Is it possible to have a part that would have the control direction as "down" in the VAB?

Also, the TAC imbalances are still there. I checked, the stock 3-kerbal capsule has 3 units of oxygen. The VA capsule has about 1600. I don't know how long either will last, but I think that much shouldn't be there.

I do appreciate shifting the parts in the tech tree, thanks! It makes much more sense now!

Hi!

I am aware of the TKS control, block orientation stuff. It's tricky, I could have the part default being flipped upside down, but that seems a bit of a fudge solution to the issue + it would break saves.

Yeah, controlling from the docking port somewhat fixes the issue (aside from IVA), but that still isn't great.

For now, I'll see if there is someway to flip orientation.

On TAC, you'll have to forgive me as I don't use it and don't really know what's "standard". The VA Capsule is from TAC's "Auto-Add_Resources" function for a 3-Kerbal part. I'll probably base the next releases TAC config on the bespoke configs made for stock parts

Edit: A temporary solution to the orientation issue, but if you have raster prop monitor, you can use the "Target" menu to select the rear docking port and control IVA with the correct orientation.

Edited September 3, 2014 by Beale

That way they'd be available as tweakables, but wouldn't be onboard by default. It would also give us a reason to use the Hamal / Progress / Etc.

By empty I just mean amount=0 while maxamount=100, or some value that makes sense.
